etymology.description: Depicts a person facing forward -> Borrowed phonetically for 'big'; original form of 夫(夫) (fū, 'man')
etymology.interpretation: The character 大(dà) depicts a person facing forward, representing 'big' by suggesting the idea of someone standing prominently. Although often thought of as a person with outstretched arms, early scripts do not support this interpretation. It was originally the form of 夫(夫) (fū, 'man') and was later phonetically borrowed for the meaning 'big.'

examples.chinese: 这个房子很大(這個房子很大)。
大海波涛汹涌(大海波濤洶湧)，展现出大自然的力量(展現出大自然的力量)。
examples.pinyin: Dàhǎi bōtāo xiōngyǒng, zhǎnxiàn chū dàzìrán de lìliàng.
examples.english: The vast ocean waves surge, showcasing the power of nature.

examples.chinese: 大人物登场(大人物登場)，留下传奇(留下傳奇)。
examples.english: Great figures make an appearance, leaving behind legends.
